summary: This is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, dated January 28, 2020. It contains a request to create a chart comparing media coverage of announcements related to Michael Avenatti and Jeffrey Epstein, along with a link to a media report on the previous day's coverage.

persons.name: Michael Avenatti
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject of a media announcement to be compared with coverage of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject of a media announcement to be compared with coverage of Michael Avenatti.

connections.description: Both are subjects of media announcements that are to be compared in a chart, as requested by the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Media coverage day
events.description: The email references a 'quick media report on yesterday's coverage,' indicating media activity on January 27, 2020.

events.title: Request for media comparison chart
events.description: An internal request is made at the U.S. Attorney's Office to create a chart comparing media announcements related to Avenatti and Epstein.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively monitoring media coverage related to Jeffrey Epstein and Michael Avenatti in January 2020.
An internal request was made to create a comparative chart of media announcements concerning Avenatti and Epstein.
The document indicates coordinated media analysis by the Public Affairs office within the Department of Justice.
